meanings.definition: To exclude or banish from a group or society.
meanings.sent1: The group decided to outcast the troublemaker for causing disruptions.
meanings.sent2: She was outcasted from the team after breaking the rules multiple times.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party outcasted anyone who didn't wear a silly hat.
meanings.sent4: In the game of tag, the fastest runner outcasts all others with ease.
meanings.sent5: The principal's strict rules outcasted many students from the school dance.

meanings.definition: The act of casting out or expelling someone.
meanings.sent1: His outcasting from the club was a result of his constant misbehavior.
meanings.sent2: The outcasting of the student was a last resort for the school administration.
meanings.sent3: The outcasting of the cat from the house led to a funny chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The outcasting of the old furniture made room for the new, modern pieces.
meanings.sent5: The outcasting of the villain from the kingdom brought peace to the land.

meanings.definition: The state of being rejected or ostracized by others.
meanings.sent1: Her outcasting by her friends left her feeling lonely and sad.
meanings.sent2: The outcasting of the new student was a cruel act of bullying.
meanings.sent3: The outcasting of the unpopular kid was actually a blessing in disguise.
meanings.sent4: The outcasting of the old traditions paved the way for new ideas to flourish.
meanings.sent5: The outcasting of the troublemakers improved the classroom environment.
